projectPurpose: To provide the core scanning engine for the Greenbone Community Edition, a comprehensive open-source vulnerability management solution used to identify security vulnerabilities in networks, systems, and applications.
mainFeatures: Supports various internet and industrial protocols
Uses a powerful internal programming language for vulnerability tests
Obtains tests from a daily updated feed (Greenbone Community Feed)
Integrates with other security tools via API

alternatives.name: Nessus
mainFeatures: Large plugin library with real-time updates

alternatives.name: Rapid7 Nexpose
mainFeatures: Comprehensive vulnerability management and risk assessment
Prioritization based on exploitability (Real Risk Score)

alternatives.name: Acunetix
mainFeatures: Focus on web application security testing (DAST, IAST)
High speed and accuracy, low false positives

marketPositioning: The openvas-scanner is the core component of the Greenbone Community Edition (GCE), positioning it as a powerful, open-source vulnerability scanning engine within a larger open-source vulnerability management framework. Unlike proprietary alternatives such as Nessus, Qualys, and Rapid7 Nexpose, GCE offers a free and transparent solution for vulnerability assessment. It competes by providing a comprehensive feature set including diverse protocol support, performance tuning, a robust testing language, and integration capabilities, making it a strong choice for users and organizations prioritizing cost-effectiveness, customization, and control over their scanning infrastructure. Its role as the scanning engine in GCE allows it to serve as an accessible entry point into vulnerability management, complementing Greenbone's commercial offerings which provide additional enterprise-grade features and support.
